verses.niv: 23 Whatever you do, work at it with all your heart, as working for the Lord, not for men,
verses.kjv: 23 And whatsoever ye do, do it heartily, as to the Lord, and not unto men;
verses.esv: 23 Whatever you do, work heartily, as for the Lord and not for men,

verses.niv: 4 The sluggard craves and gets nothing, but the desires of the diligent are fully satisfied.
verses.kjv: 4 The soul of the sluggard desireth, and hath nothing: but the soul of the diligent shall be made fat.
verses.esv:
4   The soul of the sluggard craves and gets nothing,
    while the soul of the diligent is richly supplied.

verses.niv: 23 All hard work brings a profit, but mere talk leads only to poverty.
verses.kjv: 23 In all labour there is profit: but the talk of the lips tendeth only to penury.
verses.esv:
23   In all toil there is profit,
    but mere talk tends only to poverty.

verses.kjv: 13 I can do all things through Christ which strengtheneth me.
verses.niv: 13 I can do everything through him who gives me strength.
verses.esv: 13 I can do all things through him who strengthens me.

verses.niv: 10 For even when we were with you, we gave you this rule: "If a man will not work, he shall not eat." 11 We hear that some among you are idle. They are not busy; they are busybodies. 12 Such people we command and urge in the Lord Jesus Christ to settle down and earn the bread they eat.
verses.kjv: 10 For even when we were with you, this we commanded you, that if any would not work, neither should he eat. 11 For we hear that there are some which walk among you disorderly, working not at all, but are busybodies. 12 Now them that are such we command and exhort by our Lord Jesus Christ, that with quietness they work, and eat their own bread.
verses.esv: 10 For even when we were with you, we would give you this command: If anyone is not willing to work, let him not eat. 11 For we hear that some among you walk in idleness, not busy at work, but busybodies. 12 Now such persons we command and encourage in the Lord Jesus Christ to do their work quietly and to earn their own living.

verses.niv: 3 Commit to the LORD whatever you do, and your plans will succeed.
verses.kjv: 3 Commit thy works unto the LORD, and thy thoughts shall be established.
verses.esv:
3   Commit your work to the LORD,
    and your plans will be established.

verses.niv: 14 Do everything without complaining or arguing, 15 so that you may become blameless and pure, children of God without fault in a crooked and depraved generation, in which you shine like stars in the universe
verses.kjv: 14 Do all things without murmurings and disputings: 15 That ye may be blameless and harmless, the sons of God, without rebuke, in the midst of a crooked and perverse nation, among whom ye shine as lights in the world;
verses.esv: 14 Do all things without grumbling or disputing, 15 that you may be blameless and innocent, children of God without blemish in the midst of a crooked and twisted generation, among whom you shine as lights in the world,

verses.niv: 24 Diligent hands will rule, but laziness ends in slave labor.
verses.kjv: 24 The hand of the diligent shall bear rule: but the slothful shall be under tribute.
verses.esv:
24   The hand of the diligent will rule,
    while the slothful will be put to forced labor.

verses.niv: 31 So whether you eat or drink or whatever you do, do it all for the glory of God.
verses.kjv: 31 Whether therefore ye eat, or drink, or whatsoever ye do, do all to the glory of God.
verses.esv: 31 So, whether you eat or drink, or whatever you do, do all to the glory of God.

verses.niv: 11 Make it your ambition to lead a quiet life, to mind your own business and to work with your hands, just as we told you, 12 so that your daily life may win the respect of outsiders and so that you will not be dependent on anybody.
verses.kjv: 11 And that ye study to be quiet, and to do your own business, and to work with your own hands, as we commanded you; 12 That ye may walk honestly toward them that are without, and that ye may have lack of nothing.
verses.esv: 11 and to aspire to live quietly, and to mind your own affairs, and to work with your hands, as we instructed you, 12 so that you may walk properly before outsiders and be dependent on no one.

verses.niv: 37 For nothing is impossible with God."
verses.kjv: 37 For with God nothing shall be impossible.
verses.esv: 37 For nothing will be impossible with God.”

verses.niv: 10 Whatever your hand finds to do, do it with all your might, for in the grave, where you are going, there is neither working nor planning nor knowledge nor wisdom.
verses.kjv: 10 Whatsoever thy hand findeth to do, do it with thy might; for there is no work, nor device, nor knowledge, nor wisdom, in the grave, whither thou goest.
verses.esv: 10 Whatever your hand finds to do, do it with your might, for there is no work or thought or knowledge or wisdom in Sheol, to which you are going.

verses.niv: 17 And whatever you do, whether in word or deed, do it all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God the Father through him.
verses.kjv: 17 And whatsoever ye do in word or deed, do all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God and the Father by him.
verses.esv: 17 And whatever you do, in word or deed, do everything in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God the Father through him.

verses.niv: 8 If anyone does not provide for his relatives, and especially for his immediate family, he has denied the faith and is worse than an unbeliever.
verses.kjv: 8 But if any provide not for his own, and specially for those of his own house, he hath denied the faith, and is worse than an infidel.
verses.esv: 8 But if anyone does not provide for his relatives, and especially for members of his household, he has denied the faith and is worse than an unbeliever.

verses.niv: 9 Let us not become weary in doing good, for at the proper time we will reap a harvest if we do not give up.
verses.kjv: 9 And let us not be weary in well doing: for in due season we shall reap, if we faint not.
verses.esv: 9 And let us not grow weary of doing good, for in due season we will reap, if we do not give up.

verses.niv: 24 since you know that you will receive an inheritance from the Lord as a reward. It is the Lord Christ you are serving.
verses.kjv: 24 Knowing that of the Lord ye shall receive the reward of the inheritance: for ye serve the Lord Christ.
verses.esv: 24 knowing that from the Lord you will receive the inheritance as your reward. You are serving the Lord Christ.

verses.niv: 6 The hardworking farmer should be the first to receive a share of the crops.
verses.kjv: 6 The husbandman that laboureth must be first partaker of the fruits.
verses.esv: 6 It is the hard-working farmer who ought to have the first share of the crops.

verses.niv: 11 He who works his land will have abundant food, but he who chases fantasies lacks judgment.
verses.kjv: 11 He that tilleth his land shall be satisfied with bread: but he that followeth vain persons is void of understanding.
verses.esv:
11   Whoever works his land will have plenty of bread,
    but he who follows worthless pursuits lacks sense.

verses.niv: 7 In everything set them an example by doing what is good. In your teaching show integrity, seriousness 8 and soundness of speech that cannot be condemned, so that those who oppose you may be ashamed because they have nothing bad to say about us.
verses.kjv: 7 In all things shewing thyself a pattern of good works: in doctrine shewing uncorruptness, gravity, sincerity, 8 Sound speech, that cannot be condemned; that he that is of the contrary part may be ashamed, having no evil thing to say of you.
verses.esv: 7 Show yourself in all respects to be a model of good works, and in your teaching show integrity, dignity, 8 and sound speech that cannot be condemned, so that an opponent may be put to shame, having nothing evil to say about us.

verses.niv: 15 The LORD God took the man and put him in the Garden of Eden to work it and take care of it.
verses.kjv: 15 And the LORD God took the man, and put him into the garden of Eden to dress it and to keep it.
verses.esv: 15 The LORD God took the man and put him in the garden of Eden to work it and keep it.

verses.niv: 6 Go to the ant, you sluggard; consider its ways and be wise! 7 It has no commander, no overseer or ruler, 8 yet it stores its provisions in summer and gathers its food at harvest.
verses.kjv: 6 Go to the ant, thou sluggard; consider her ways, and be wise: 7 Which having no guide, overseer, or ruler, 8 Provideth her meat in the summer, and gathereth her food in the harvest.
verses.esv:
6   Go to the ant, O sluggard;
    consider her ways, and be wise.
7   Without having any chief,
    officer, or ruler,
8   she prepares her bread in summer
    and gathers her food in harvest.

verses.niv: 7 Serve wholeheartedly, as if you were serving the Lord, not men,
verses.kjv: 7 With good will doing service, as to the Lord, and not to men:
verses.esv: 7 rendering service with a good will as to the Lord and not to man,

verses.niv: 35 In everything I did, I showed you that by this kind of hard work we must help the weak, remembering the words the Lord Jesus himself said: 'It is more blessed to give than to receive.'"
verses.kjv: 35 I have shewed you all things, how that so labouring ye ought to support the weak, and to remember the words of the Lord Jesus, how he said, It is more blessed to give than to receive.
verses.esv: 35 In all things I have shown you that by working hard in this way we must help the weak and remember the words of the Lord Jesus, how he himself said, ‘It is more blessed to give than to receive.’”

verses.niv: 2 You will eat the fruit of your labor; blessings and prosperity will be yours.
verses.kjv: 2 For thou shalt eat the labour of thine hands: happy shalt thou be, and it shall be well with thee.
verses.esv:
2   You shall eat the fruit of the labor of your hands;
    you shall be blessed, and it shall be well with you.

verses.niv: 11 For I know the plans I have for you," declares the LORD, "plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future.
verses.kjv: 11 For I know the thoughts that I think toward you, saith the LORD, thoughts of peace, and not of evil, to give you an expected end.
verses.esv: 11 For I know the plans I have for you, declares the LORD, plans for welfare and not for evil, to give you a future and a hope.
